intro: Arthrocnemum bidens, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing, succulent shrub that thrives in harsh desert environments, often forming dense mats to reduce water loss. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that are adapted to store water, and its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, appearing in clusters. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for desert wildlife. Arthrocnemum bidens is also used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
